Description: Pectoral cross; steatite; incised with a diagonal cross in the centre, linear decoration on the limbs; pierced in the upper limb for suspension.
Curator's comments: Parallels: Y. Israeli & D. Mevorah (eds), Cradle of Christianity (Jerusalem 2000) 141; G. Marjanović-Vujović, Crosses, 6th-12th C., from the Collection of National Museum (Belgrade 1987) cat. 75; M. V. Gill, "The Small Finds", in: M. Harrison, Excavations at Saraçhane in Istanbul, vol. 1 (Princeton 1986) cat. 627-628; J. Durand et al., Armenia sacra: mémoire chrétienne des Arméniens, IVe-XVIIIe siècle (Paris 2007) cat. 98; P. Špehar & O. Zorova, "Christianity on the Territory of the Archbishopric of Ohrid", in: M. Salomon et al. (eds), Rome, Constantinople and Newly-Converted Europe, vol. 1 (Cracow 2012) 429-446, esp. 438: fig.6.7; I. O. Kanonidis, "Enkolpia Excavated from Late Byzantine Cemeteries in Thessaloniki", Museum of Byzantine Culture 9 (2002) 65-81: cat. 3.
Bibliographic references: Dalton 1901 / Catalogue of Early Christian Antiquities and Objects from the Christian East in the Department of British and Medieval Antiquities and Ethnography of the British Museum (978)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
